Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: tlf1006
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two teenagers at the Pelham hotel for four nights in February 2012. We had deluxe double and luxury twin rooms at the front of the hotel on the second floor. Both rooms were very clean, large and well equipped. The deluxe double had a walk in closet and large bathroom. The luxury twin, the cheaper of the rooms, was not in any way small. Service at the hotel was invariably excellent, particularly the concierge. The hotel is across the street from the South Kensington underground station which we used throughout our trip. There are also many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. This is a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly appointed, Solidly maintained, Spotless bathrooms, Attentive staff & concierges, Great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: I have been a long-time patron of the Pelham in South Kensington. Was welcomed there again for a several-night stay and the service was the best EVER. Front desk staff warm, understanding, attentive, and they recognize me and remember my room -every- time! Amazing. My special requests (boxes, packing materials, etc.) have always been well-handled and punctual. The neighborhood has shifted to a more pedestrian-friendly mentality, just outside South Kensington tube station. Wide array of restaurants in immediate area, from high-end Thai to common desires like Starbucks and Pret a Manger. The rooms are all unique, though appointed in a similar manner, and the "build" is immaculate... strong, sturdy, and very English! The bathrooms are maintained to an astounding level of cleanliness, and are basically beautiful granite floors and walls with rich walnut wood trims. The ---quality--- of literally everything is some of the finest I've seen... bed linens, towels, amenities, etc. If room size is your priority, enquire in advance and book appropriately, as my last room was HUGE! Quiet and lovely, private and peaceful. You cannot expect a huge room if you are paying for the least-expensive option, in my opinion. I would describe the hotel and experience there as "traditional English" which is great is that is your desire. It is not a clean-lined, modern hotel... a touch frilly but if you want a boring chain hotel, look elsewhere. In three words: IMMACULATE, APPOINTED, MEMORABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Pelham as good as ever but...”
Reviews.Author: Anissesofia
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is always my first choice in London. You are treated beautifully by the staff, rooms are elegant and location is fabulous. However, I have to say one thing really, really annoys me - they charge for wifi internet. Why? When even the smallest hotels and B&Bs round the world offer this for free now, why does the Pelham need to make this extra profit at the risk of annoying savvy international customers. Make a stand, Pelham, be different and strike out with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, a truly unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilly2
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, wonderful service and superbly well appointed rooms. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Denmelb
Reviews.Content: is a little expensive, but luxurious. Staff outstanding. Beware of noisy rooms and they are not all the same. Outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in South Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Huuhu
Reviews.Content: Formerly a Firmdale hotel, the property retains all the meticulously decorated rooms and public spaces. Very accommodating staff. Wonderfully located directly across from the S. Kensington tube station along with a bus stop in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jacqueline Harvey at The Pelham”
Reviews.Author: BespokeBlog
Reviews.Content: On an unseasonably warm and sunny February afternoon in London, I walked out of South Kensington station and smiled as I saw large numbers of happy people sitting outside basking in the sunshine whilst sipping on coffees and nibbling on cakes. I wanted to join in but I was on my way to something much better. I crossed the road and entered The Pelham, a delightful boutique hotel, which spans three conjoining Georgian townhouses. Upon entry I was shown to the drawing room. Warm, cosy and littered with luxurious furniture, artworks, dark oak panelled walls and an honesty bar, the room was a complete contrast to the sunny weather outside and I could see myself sitting by the coal fire on a cold winters evening with a good book and a glass of red. Read more at . . . http://blog.bespokersvp.com/2012/03/jacqueline-harvey-at-the-pelham/

Reviews.Title: “A very special venue!”
Reviews.Author: Janet G
Reviews.Content: I had my 40th birthday party at the Pelham Hotel in January 2012. Bistro Fifteen was the perfect size for my 50+ guests and proved the most delightful setting for what was a very special evening. The hotel management had taken considerable time to dress the room for such an occasion and I was delighted with the result. My hotel room was very luxurious, exceeding my (already high) expectations for a five star hotel. I was extremely impressed by the care and attention to detail taken by all members of staff at the Pelham, and particularly the front of house and bar staff. Many of my guests commented on the ‘above and beyond’ hospitality offered by the hotel, and I know that some of them are now planning a weekend break at the hotel so that they can sample that generosity once again! I cannot recommend Bistro 15 and the Pelham highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: Pat E
Reviews.Content: You know how travel sites always show great shots of hotels--and how disappointing it can be when the real thing doesn't pan out? Well, that's not the case here. Nothing you see online can hold a candle to the fabulous experience of staying at the Pelham. Not only is the place just as beautiful as it looks in pics, it's staffed with people who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Plus, it's perfectly situated. Take the tube from Heathrow to the South Kensington station, and there you are, at the hotel, right in the middle of a vibrant, walkable neighborhood, just steps or a train from everything--pubs, shops, museums, theater, restaurants--LONDON, in all it's wonderful glory. If you happen to be there on a Saturday morning, check out a real insider's treat: Her Majesty's Horse Guards, exercising the horses along the quiet streets, 7 am. After years of staying in posh chains and disappointing boutiques, we finally found our home in London, thanks to a recommendation from a friend (thanks, Larry!). Check this out. You will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff! Small Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Reiser1
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff very wonderful and attentive and the place is amazingly clean. The reception rooms on the ground floor are very stylish and have a ton of daily newspapers to read. Unfortunately, the rooms are very small (not much bigger than the bed). I looked at the floorplan on the door and most other rooms looked about the same. But for London this is probably normal. In my particular room there was also the problem of a door-slamming neighbour which was more than annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LuxeConcierge
Reviews.Content: I would like to begin by saying thank you to everyone that made my stay at The Pelham a true delight. I had the luxury of staying here during the Les Clefs D'Or Congress a couple of weeks ago and am I ever glad that I did! Everyone that I encountered exuded genuine and sincere hospitality, without being over-bearing, hovering, or intrusive. They anticipated my every need and made me feel so welcome. I was on a first name basis with everyone by the time I had to go home! I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edith G
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to London for some business meetings and decided to extend my trip over the weekend. The staff were wonderful. My rooms was a little small but the decor was gorgeous. It made all the difference to come back at the end of teh day to a pretty room, not just some Holiday inn box. The Reception girls were so happy all the time- they were ready to talk and gave me some good tips for shopping. The Concierge was great too- I asked for some recommendations for a musical or theatre and he was able to get me a really good ticket on short notice. I would highly recommend the Continental Breakfast- nice and simple. Just what you need to start the day. The Restaurant staff were efficient and the Supervisors during Dinner were quite lively. Overall, this was a wonderful hotel and the staff gave such personalised service thst it was an absolute joy to come back at the end of the day. I will definitely be going back to the Pelham on my next visit to London and I am already planning a romantic weekend away for myself and my boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of South Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Gosnold10
Reviews.Content: As with other firmdale hotels the rooms are beautifully appointed and the bathrooms are superb. The hotel is right next to the Natural history and Victoria and Albert museums. The staff including the receptionists have been very responsive. The restaurant is first rate and the breakfast is one of the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “Still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CPHDot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over New Years as we did last year too, and the hotel was still wonderful, in fact I would say it was even better this time around, especially the restaurant. I am such a big fan of breakfast and the choice at the Pelham is world class - eggs benedict still being my favorite, it was superb! I am not a city person by nature so staying at a hotel like The Pelham is what really completes a London trip for me ... knowing I have a cosy room to go back to after having survived the shopping crowds. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior design - Shame about the receptionist & barman”
Reviews.Author: chick_chickDubai
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pelham for one night over New Years Eve. The hotel is beautifully designed with traditional and modern elements blended together very eloquently. The room that we stayed in was very well configured with everything in the right place. The brunch in the morning was also great value for money and of a good quality standard. Overall we had a great experience but there were a couple of areas of improvement that if the hotel takes notice of this review, will help to increase the overall customer experience. As after all, it is classified as a 5-star luxury boutique hotel. The first customer service hiccup was when we went to the bar/restaurant to order drinks. When we requested a Bloody Mary, the barman had no idea how to make it and had to ask the Restaurant Manager. We had to wait for around 15 minutes until someone could figure out how to make one of the world's most easiest drinks. The same barman also recommended that I order a Campari Spritz. I live in Italy so I know what this drink should taste like. The one that was served to me was watery with not kick and served in a huge tumbler. Not exactly the taste and presentation I was expecting. The second customer hiccup was on New Years Day when we were checking out. We had decided to book a reservation for the in-laws for their upcoming trip to London. I had previously checked the rates on the hotel website of which there was a 3for2 promotion. I decided it was easier to make the reservation face-to-face but reception was unable to give me the same promotion on her reservation system. Clearly, they have problems with rate parity. I therefore made the booking online in the end. The same receptionist also looked as though she hadn't come home from the night before. Her uniform was completely creased and her hair looked liked a huge bird's nest. Her nails were painted electric pink which were grotesque and vulgar to look at. When I told her that she should iron her jumper, she replied " Oooh....I know" in such a ditsy manner. And this is the public image of a 5 star hotel??? Clearly this poorly trained girl needs to move to a back-of-house job instead. So apart from those two encounters, I am willing to return the Pelham with pleasure. I just hope that on my next visit, there is a barman that knows how to make cocktails and receptionist that is able to use an iron and maybe look at herself in the mirror from time-to-time.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but ruined by cool reception”
Reviews.Author: Dealight
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for V&A and Harrods. Modern flowers,sumptous fabrics in lounge ( with well stocked honesty bar). Room was reasonable size, designer decorated with small but functional bathroom. Concierge was welcoming and helpful. The only reason we would not return was the surly attitude of the girl on Reception. Busy on PC, no eye contact or smile, we had to atract her attention. She asked us for proof on identity which she photocopied. We queried this as we live in Kent but she did not offer any meaningful response. In the morning we paid the bill and queried an additional £4.65 added to our self service "inclusive continental breakfast". It was a tip/service charge which was not warranted for bringing us 2 coffees.When we said goodbye as we left next morning a different receptionist did not raise her head or respond. A lovely property but lacking a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DawnIslamabad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pelham for about a week over Christmas. The staff are fantastic, the rooms are great and the location is perfect. I had stayed here many years back, and the Pelham, while wonderful then, is just perfect now. The attention to detail is remarkable, and my family indicated that the staff were fantastic when it came to facilitating delivery of a Christmas treat for me on arrival. I recommend it absolutely. Thanks for everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Homely luxury”
Reviews.Author: kaptajnp
Reviews.Content: I stayed The Pelham during New Year 2011/12. This is a luxury boutique hotel that in my opinion far exceeds the experiences you get at the larger 5-star hotels. The Pelham has a personal touch in everything, and evidently a lot of thought is put into the small details which make you feel special and welcome at the hotel. Location couldn't be better - you only have to cross the road from the South Kensington tube exit, and you are there. Within walking distance you have several shopping possibilities, fine restaurants, and museums, and it is very easy to get to Heathrow (or other parts of London) from the hotel. The hotel has a library and a small lounge with a relaxed and cozy atmosphere. The rooms are different from each other, so you might want to check what is available when you arrive. The room we got (#405) was an experience! Nice wallpaper with exotic animal displays, classic furniture with a modern twist, and a fabulous view of the city. Staff was very attentive, pleasant, and ...humorous! I recommend this hotel if you want it extra special.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Posthuman
Reviews.Content: The Pelham Hotel must be the best hotel I've ever been to. The style is very Victorian which I really like. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The breakfast was very tasty, everything fresh and you have a selection of continental and some other as well. The restaurant serves very delicious steaks as well! The staff is very friendly and very professional in what they're doing. In front of this hotel there's also a cosy bar and next to it there's the underground. On the left of the hotel, there's the history museum which unfortunately I didn't have time to visit. Also, about 10 mins away from the hotel, there's the Royal Albert Hall and if you're lucky, you can see amazing shows there or else enjoy a nice walk in Hyde Park! The hotel is not cheap, but it's very clean, quite and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rolf0000
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again and would be happy to recommend it to anyone; as it has been well reviewed I don't need to repeat info here. A couple of small niggles prevented me from giving the hotel 5 points: 1. Their website prices exclude VAT making them look 20% cheaper than they really are. 2. When I called to book a double room the booking person tried to sell me a larger room claiming the standard double was too small for two people - unless we were unknowingly upgraded I would say that their standard double and queen size bed are fine for a night or two in any capital city. 3. Service charge was added whenever one orders anything in-house - just a bit annoying and petty. 4. Reception and ground floor staff were excellent but the waiting staff for breakfast were either hung over or intentionally gruff - could be a language barrier as they did not seem to speak English. 5. Wifi: 20 Pounds for 24 hours - again a petty way to bump up the bill. Positives: Civilised atmosphere, perfect for local museums and tube, a safe environment for single travellers, good quality linen etc in bedrooms; a couple of relaxing reception rooms with honesty bar and warm fires.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Teresa H
Reviews.Content: I love the Pelham. We recently spent five nights there, and we will definitely stay there again during our next London trip. The location is outstanding. Right across from the South Kensington tube (Circle, District and Picadilly lines), yet it's a quiet area. You have many dining options nearby. The concierge and room services are outstanding. The rooms we have personally experienced are large (by European standards), and the bathrooms are updated (granite). Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in South Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Mingus123
Reviews.Content: Small townhouse hotel. Ultra convienent for tourists. Across the street from The Tube and steps away from the V&A Musuem and the History Musuem. Very nicely furnished and moderately spacious. Staff is excellent but Concierge service is at times somewhat limiting. No views and our window faced a brick wall

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms,great location and great staff.My favorite in London”
Reviews.Author: justjerry
Reviews.Content: I have stayed dozens of times here and gets only better.Super concierge and staff make it a pleasure each time I return.The only problem is they are sometimes full and have to go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bigshiney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Pelham Hotel for business for over a year on and off and can honestly say it is one of my favourite hotels! I have to stay away on business frequently however staying in The Pelham is a real pleasure. I would be very happy to stay there for pleasure as well. The staff are really attentive and always remember to put allergy-free pillows in my room instead of feather ones. The hotel is of the highest quality in every respect. The location is perfect for accessing London and there are lots of lovely restaurants nearby. The breakfast is excellent with particularly good home-made muffins!! Whenever i'm in London I would always choose to stay in The Pelham!

Reviews.Title: “The Pelham is a true GEM!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferCanfield
Reviews.Content: I was overjoyed when I walked into the Pelham Hotel on the day of my check in. I was early and had to leave for a mtg (even though my trip in London was only a short personal visit) and when I returned hours later, my bags were in my room and the staff was so attentive and thoughtful. I love the decor as it is truly special. It is sophisticated and charming and like nothing I have seen before. This is the treat about staying in a boutique hotel - The Pelham is unique to all other hotels, big or small. It has a feminine feel yet not too feminine that a man would feel uncomfortable. The honesty bar in the lounge is a cute idea and the room is incredible with new furnishings in the up to date color schemes with classic english antiques ... a true and fabulous juxtaposition! I will certainly stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Love it and made my stay in London more special that I expected this time around. Thanks so much !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: gjohnsonwest
Reviews.Content: We love, love, loved this hotel! The location was perfect as it is right across from the South Kensington Station. The room was charming and luxurious. And, we found the staff to be absolutely lovely. Every question was answered, and we truly felt at home in this hotel. We traveled all over Europe and the Pelham was far and away our best hotel experience. We cannot recommend it highly enough and cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but very noisy, and only ok service”
Reviews.Author: lenorenewyork
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right across from the South Kensington Tube and in a great neighborhood near shops and museums, BUT I had a room facing the street and it was very noisy. The service was also mediocre pretty much across the board with one or two exceptions. The breakfast staff seemed sullen. The first day my room wasn't made up at all and I was told you needed to put a sign on your door if you wanted it made up! The concierges who also functioned as doormen were cheerful and helpful but trying to get answers on tickets had a couple of stops and starts, reached high expections in some moments, fell down in others. I booked in here at the last minute as my normal favorite hotel was full when I came to London suddenly. While this is a nice place, I will not be returning and will be going back to my normal London Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great attention, lovely facilities. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: ErinMNelson
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed it immensely. The staff is outstanding. I had a late-night need to print something but was having email firewall issues so couldn't get it mailed to reception for printing. The night manager found a USB key, brought it to my room at 4am, collected the file, printed and bound it, and returned it within 15 minutes. When I returned the next night, he asked "how did your talk go"?. Loved that the staff say "welcome home" each night and mean it. Terrific facilities. Wonderful linens. Comfy beds. Looking forward to returning in just a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, poor service, wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: krakito
Reviews.Content: Very good location BUT the bedrooms are very small, noisy and smell like an old house.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable chic hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rockhopper88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here s their sister hotel No 16 was fully booked. I was pleasantly surprised. Old english country house charm with a modern edge. I was welcomed with a friendly smile and shown to my room. A good sized king room at back of hotel. My only objection was there was no ipod dock as in their other hotel. The room was immaculately clean as was the bathroom. And the curtains are well lined so you really do get a black out for sleeping. The buffet breakfast was delightful, homemade muffins a variety of breads yoghurts fresh fruits with the option to have a cooked breakfast. Juice freshly squeezed to order. Quiet unfussy service in the basement restaurant with newspapers. Honesty bar in the two sitting rooms which were very comfortable. It was very wet when i stayed and their were plenty of umbrellas for guests to use. Perfectly located for tube(Heathrow on Picadilly Line) across road and museums. Bus stops outside for buses to central london and a short 10 minute walk to Kings Road shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: MichelleNY123
Reviews.Content: I can not rave enough about what an amazing little place the Pelham has proved to be. This tranquil, calm masterpiece of a hotel makes you forget that you are in the centre of busy London and let’s you relax and feel at home. It’s key highlight has to be the drawing room, it is set up to feel like your own living room with two couches, a fire place and an open bar for you to help yourself as much as you like (at a fee of course). The corridors feel homely and the rooms are designed in fabrics which give a very comforting feeling. The staff are all great, they strive to help you as much as they can and the concierge team are extremely knowledgeable. I loved room service breakfast, brought to you covered in silver closhes and presented straight into bed, what a great start to the day. All in all I loved this hotel, because it is unique, and it really does feel like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: ack40
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I chose this hotel because of all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor but it didn't live up to its reputation. The first room that we were given was on the first floor and the subway literally ran underneath it every 3 minutes. When I complained about the noise and the rattling, the front desk said that they had one other room that they could give us at the same price or we could pay more to be upgraded. The next room was extremely tiny and it smelled musty. The mattress on the bed was sub-par and the sink didn't drain. The heater on the towel rack was also broken and made the temperature in the bathroom unbearably hot. Overall, the hotel's location is very noisy and not relaxing. For almost $500 a night(which was the lowest price point), you can find a better hotel... The Pelham is very disappointing and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: auntiemame333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pelham Hotel in London two years ago and found everything to our liking. Perfect location for the tubes and central London. The hotel has a boutique feel, the room was spacious relative to European standards...three adults stayed there a week. The restaurant serves yummy breakfast. The staff was very attentive...saved us over $1000 in theatre tickets by using their connections (concierge) and one of the night staff brought me scones and tea each evening as I worked from 2-4 in the morning to hook up with colleagues state side. We stayed in a different place this year to have a different experience...would go right back to the Pelham next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great room sizes and location”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: For a central London boutique hotel the room was surprisingly spacious as was the bathroom. The bedroom and bathroom are really well appointed with everything you would need. The bed very comfortable. The window in the bedroom had stained glass, there was no view, it looks out over the service area, it's the way things are in those kinds of buildings in London and Vienna etc. Staff on reception were very friendly but not pushy. There is a great restaurant owned by the same company right next door that we thoroughly recommend. Very reasonable prices and great food. Location is excellent, literally just a few steps from South Kensington tube station and just a few minutes walk from places like Hyde Park, Harrods, Sloane Square, etc. Altogether a great little hotel and probably much better value for money/location than some of the big chain hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pricky
Reviews.Content: Just across the South Kensington Tube station, this small, lovely hotel has a perfect location for walking around and for transportation facilities. The staff was very friendly, the decoration was very niceand it was very clean for a London Hotel. We stayed in a comfy Deluxe Double Room. Our bed was so big, it made the room look small but the room was stil big enough to accomodate an additional folding bed. I will stay in no other hotel in London anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, a gem, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: cahNYC820
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is a beautiful gem of a hotel. Each of the shared sitting rooms are beautifully designed, somewhere you would actually want to spend time enjoying a tea or cocktail. Our room was very large (especially by european standards), comfortable and very stylishly decorated. The continental breakfast is the best I've ever had a hotel with lots of varieties of fresh berries and delicious pastries. The a la carte items are delicious as well. The location is so convenient, right across from the South Ken Tube. Once you enter the hotel you're transported to an elegant haven of tranquility and the bustle of the street dissipates immediately. On top of all that the staff are so helpful, courteous, and kind. The rooms are very comfortable, beautifully decorated and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic independent hotel with great personal service”
Reviews.Author: Clairoy
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Pelham and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else when I come to London. The hotel is beautifully furnished and the rooms are individually designed and always spotlessly clean. The location is great, South Kensington being vibrant with nice shops and restaurants whilst not suffering the hoards which can afflict the west end. Perhaps the biggest compliment I can offer the Pelham relates to the quality of the service we have received from all members of staff, on all of our separate visits. It is a reflection of a smaller, independent hotel that staff members recognise guests by name and can offer an incredibly professional, personal service. During our first visit the concierge engaged our 10 year old son in conversation about his day and ended up having to eat some salt and vinegar flavoured insects which my son had prchased from a shop in Covent Garden! This was done with good cheer by the concierge and my son was thrilled to bits; evidently all guests are important to this hotel, whatever their age! I would have no hesitation in recommending the Pelham to any potential visitor to the capital, as long as there is always room available for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and service we have experienced in London!”
Reviews.Author: crossie_2002
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pelham hotel and couldnt believe how good the location was - you can see the V & A from the front rooms and its across the road from Kensington tube station. The staff were faultless and couldnt do enough to help us. The concierge recommended a local Italian restaurant for dinner which was also fantastic! We hope to stay there again in the future and thoroughly recommend the hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Exhausted traveller given the best of service”
Reviews.Author: TravelandL
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review. I arrived from Asia for a short few days having previously stayed at the Pelham under former management. After a bit of a kefuffle with the room I had requested I accepted a room and would change in morning. I am not an easy client I even had walked around corner to The Number Sixteen to inquire after room availablity- a back-up, if I wasn't shown any leeway in the morning. The rooms are nice, clean, yet small each with it's own quirks, so I wanted the quirks that worked for me. Small doesn't work if you have a large suitcase that doesn't fit in the room. With a bit of give and take I was shown a few rooms and happy in the final one- that is all it took. After this everyone who worked there, most especially the doormen/bellmen, were perfectly nice and friendly. The concierge was quick to get reservations and supply my questions with answers, researched if he didn't know. Breakfast a joy with the service. I find the location great for getting around to the V & A etc.

Reviews.Title: “A little haven in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: johnHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at The Pelham in South Kensington. The location is perfect and we adored the whole feel and ambience of the hotel. The rooms are spacious yet cosy, each with their own idividual style and high quality finishes. We can highly reccommend a stay at The Pelham.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION, PEFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cottage37
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my husband and it was absolutley perfect! After looking at quite a few in London for the same price at large hotel chains im glad i went for a smaller boutique hotel. The service was fantastic, the breakfast was fabulous and the location was amazing! Right opposite the train station and a stones throw from the Natural History Museum. The rooms have everything in them you could need - including a great view of London. Would definatley recommend and definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place”
Reviews.Author: jrperez
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days with my family (wife and two kids) in the Pelham Hotel a the beginning of January 2011 and I must say that we had a most enjoyable stay. We were allocated in the "Mews Suite", which has a separate entrance, just round the corner from the main entrance and we felt quite independent from the rest of the hotel, which is good when you have young children that can be noisy sometimes. The Mews Suite is a wonderful room that has a great queen-sized bed and smaller one for the children upstairs in the second level within the room. The bathroom is small but very clean and with everything you need. The personnel is extremely kind, efficient and willing to help. A special comment for Rosa, at the reception desk, which gave us excellent information about what to do and how to go in London. We also required medical assistance and the receptionist sorted out everything so that we could have a doctor in our room in a short period of time. Location is also very good, only within two minutes walk from the great Natural History Museum and well communicated by tube or bus. My only major suggestion is that upholstery should be renewed, as it is getting a bit shabby

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “A magnificent choice”
Reviews.Author: Marcelinoaufdenweg
Reviews.Content: We visit London once a year, and usually try to stay in different neighbourhoods to explore different airs. The Pelham may very well have put an end to our wanderings. First off, the practical side. It's literally across the street from the South Kensington tube station, which services three lines (one of them, the Piccadilly line, which brings you straight from Heathrow.) It's one block away from the Natural History Museum, and two from the Victoria and Albert, which are both free (no small gift to the London visitor!) and hold splendid collections. It's a seven-minute walk from Hyde Park, and if you have an ample budget, fifteen minutes away from Harrods and Harvey Nichols and all of Knightsbridge. The Pelham is beautifully appointed: understated elegance finds a real expression here. (Incidentally, we were initially concerned by other reviews about the rooms being noisy. We had a room right on Cromwell, on the second floor (third, in the US), and were never bothered by noise, despite being really light sleepers.) Walk five or walk twenty minutes, and you'll find as many different restaurants as your heart desires. But the jewel of the Pelham is the staff, from the front desk to the concierge to the cleaning staff to the waiters and waitresses in the bistro downstairs: courteous, attentive, true young professionals who truly want to make your stay as pleasant as they can. Oh, and the continental breakfast is a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GuyMargriet
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is a very charming hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. The interior has a very pleasant style and the bedroom was excellent. A good bed, perfect bathroom and all nicely decorated. The location is great. Just opposite the South Kensington tubestation makes it a very convenient place to stay. We certainly will book the Pelham hotel again for our next stay iin Londen!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, beautiful room and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: theowebb
Reviews.Content: The first impression of the hotel is one of beautiful intimate grandeur - a feeling hard for a London hotel of this range to accomplish. Everything is spotless from the reception up to the bedroom as well as the staff who were incredibly friendly and accommodating as soon as we arrived. They kindly showed us to our room (the Red Room) and everything was laid out perfectly including the candles and rose petals as requested. Another brilliant complementary service from the hotel. The room was extremely comfortable and I could not have faulted anything apart from a slight sound coming through the fire door, although this was not a problem. The temperature controls were excellent and allowed for a rapid change of temperature should one require it. Breakfast in bed was excellent and a very good size although maybe the cost of this was a little too high. Nevertheless it was delicious! When we came to check out, the process was very simple and we were allowed to store the bags until the evening which was very useful. Before our train we were allowed to sit in the Drawing Room and take tea and supper whilst we waited. It was a spot of perfect comfort and tranquility and we feel very privileged to have been allowed to stay and relax before our journey. The surroundings are better than ever, with the tube line, countless restaurants and the magnificent Natural History and Science Museums at your door. Overall a highly recommended stay and one I hope I will remember for a very long time. Should I need to stay in London again, I will certainly visit the Pelham Hotel and it will be a pleasure to do so. Up there with the best...

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and wonderful stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: annalou082
Reviews.Content: A fantastic, chic and very stylish hotel which provides excellent service at very good value. The staff are all very attentive and were very caring especially with our two young children. its perfectly situated and very central. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to going back soon! Anna, Sussex

Reviews.Title: “Excellent by European Standards”
Reviews.Author: mark34515
Reviews.Content: The front desk and concierge staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The hotel is cozy, clean and comfortable but the staff provides the added value. They truly care for the guest. A lost art in stateside hotels. I appreciated the internet speed and surprisingly good food in the restaurant. The tenderloin of venison was remarkable, generous and moderately priced. It was the best meal I enjoyed in the city. My next London stay will be at The Pelham.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samantha_s_harris
Reviews.Content: My mother and I wanted to spend a few days in London and wanted a boutique hotel. I found the Pelham hotel thanks to tripadvisor. The hotel was spotless, lovely and welcoming. The staff were only too happy to help and looked after us so well. The room was a queen sized room. Beautifully decorated, warm and cosy. The bathroom was fab and the bed comfy. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location for the shops and for the tube, as well as plenty of buses, Thank you so much, Pelham hotel, you looked after us so well and meet our every need - nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and wonderful stay: just perfect”
Reviews.Author: JCZ92
Reviews.Content: Large room, charmful, magnificent decoration, perfect bathroom. The "Fifteen bistrot" is delicious and a very good plan, when children keep on sleepping safely in the room... Very good breakfast, authentic food, just charming...!! Perfect concierge departement Perfect location with South Kensington Station, near by Picadilly line, Harrod's and Hyde Park C.GRANGE, France

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel close to South Kensington station”
Reviews.Author: kmfalch
Reviews.Content: Good service at frontdesk, very good service from consierge. He gave us a lot of nice tips about gastro pubs! I had a luxury room - big room but nothing special with it. Clean bathroom but i had expected a bit more of a luxury room. Location i great. Just 5 min from Harrods and very close to V&A-museum. And the best is the short way to South Kensington underground station so you can get easy and fast around by tube. We did not have breakfast at hotel. There are a lot of nice places to hae breakfast close to hotel. What i like the most is the great consierge service and location. But value of what you get for 220 GBP could be better.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel filled with charm, elegance and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: wendy_bianchi
Reviews.Content: I selected The Pelham Hotel for our Christmas office party venue and had 27 guests attending for cocktails and canapes followed by a 3 course dinner. I chose The Pelham Hotel initially, having never stayed or visited this venue previously, because it had a homely but sophisticated feel about it and the decor complimented the Hotel superbly. The office Christmas party event was an absolute success in every respect. The staff provided us with exceptional service, the food was of a very high standard and the wine list had an excellent price range and selection of wines from various regions. Our guests also booked rooms and stayed overnight at The Pelham and each room had it's own personal characteristics and colour co-ordination which added to the comfort that each guest experienced whilst staying overnight. Congratulations to the Manager and staff at The Pelham for creating such an amazing evening for staff and colleagues. I would recommend The Pelham for events, dinner parties, hotel stays and it's central location being in South Kensington is the icing on the cake for an already top quality establishment. Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for meetings”
Reviews.Author: prodeks
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the Pelham Hotel Meeting Rooms for a business meeting on Friday. I was very impressed. The decor is chic but welcoming and the set up comfortable. From reservations through to waiting staff the service was impeccable - unobtrusive and incredibly prompt. I would highly recommend the hotel's meeting rooms for business and they would also make a great location for private events, dinners, etc.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingchrissie
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is a good reason to forget about the major chains and their reward membership programs and enjoy a wonderful boutique hotel. Each room has its own design, mine was soooo nice! A picture book English style with still a modern feel. I loved it. Breakfast is very good - extra points for fresh smoothies and fresh berries. I also had lunch there twice, both times really good. We had meetings serveral times in the private dining rooms and it is a great change to regular meeting rooms. It feels like a cozy living room with a fire place - again a great English style mixed with modern elements. I can really recomend if it suits the suits the need. The only little minus I need to mention is that I stayed there during my birthday and felt it would have been nice to receive a little card - since otherwise they do pay attention to detail. But never mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous private dining room perfect for hen night..”
Reviews.Author: tsh47
Reviews.Content: I organised a Hen party in the private dining room of this beautiful boutique hotel in S. Ken. The staff were extremely helpful and flexible with organising the day. We were a group of 13 ladies and we all had champagne afternoon tea which was delightful - big fairy and chocolate cakes, finger sandwiches and tea in a lovely private room with our own waiting staff. The day was a complete success, the girls loved it and I wouldn't hesitate in hosting another event there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great interior, staff wanting to please, poor food, and lack of management”
Reviews.Author: starshower
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Pelham for two nights as it was close to a very important event I was attending. The location was great for many reasons. South Kensington near to museums, the french quarter of London, and convenient for across London travel. The hotel benefits from good interior design, two lovely lounge/studies, and appeals as a smaller establishment. The staff were all lovely and tried hard, however, you got the impression that they did not have the level of managment oganization that could help them do any better. The food was disappointing. Menu appealed - french style, sufficient choices without being overbearing. However, the food was more of a home cooked french style standard than that of a top chef. This might explain why there was no problem getting a table in the evenings. Breakfast was adequate to good, but again more good cooking than bonne cuisine. The staff at breakfast were disorganized, badly managed and inefficient. The staff in the evening were able as they were never serving more than two tables, but lacked real understanding. The cost of our room price doubled with all the extras. There was service, vat, service on the restaurant/wine bills, fee to park the car and so on. Whilst the car park fee was fair enough for central London, the overall additions on the bill toppled up the final charge. So the £210 weekend rate room became with breakfast and dinner/wine £450 a night. For that kind of money I expect much better food, and managment. Whilst the Pelham retained a comfortable appeal for a central location it was let down by the food. I gladly paid £410 for one night, breakfast, and dinner at the Hotel Du Vin only the week before and did not feel ripped off. The Pelham left me feeling rather shortchanged.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, lots of style”
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust
Reviews.Content: This is not your average boutique hotel. As you set foot here you notice that it has style that is unlike any other (or maybe similar only to hotels created by the same decorator). I stayed here only because I got a really good deal (paid two nights, stayed three), as it is a bit out of my league. If I had to think of one characteristic it would be attention to detail. There was a fragrance tube that you could spray on the pillows a few hours before sleep that supposedly allowed for a better sleep. I can't tell you if it worked, as I slept fine, but it certainly smelled good. High points here also were the quality of the breakfast served and kindness of the staff. They managed to find tickets for a sold-out event at the The only downside of this stay (and the hotel has nothing to do with it) was that I got struck by food poisoning after eating at Pret a Manger in Brighton and that certainly affected my stay in London, as I could barely eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Small and very hospitality hotel”
Reviews.Author: TakakoT
Reviews.Content: Small and very hospitality hotel. Hence it stands the front of the south Kensington station, I could enjoy staying the city of London.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: stig99
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is a lovely hotel,it seems to get most thing right.Service is great and attentive. Has more of the feel of staying in a very elegant house,quite relaxing really. Drinks are very expensive £5.40 for small bottle of lager,however suppose it isnt going to be cheap in a 5 star hotel! There are 2 decent pubs nearby and a few local eateries(El Gaucho good for a tasty steak). Short Walk to Nat History,V and A,Geological museum etc Breakfast very good if included in room price,however at £18 not great value otherwise. All in all a great place to use as a base ,a cut above!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: live2travelmore
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the tube, dining, market and shopping. New modern bathrooms. Comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, but the accounting for it ?”
Reviews.Author: fairdos
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes of the Pelham & in general were not disappointed. Rooms are small ( we had rooms 008 & 009 ) but elegantly done with all space ingeniously commandeered - there could have been a little more drawer space, in the wasted area underneath the television, for example ( at least screen not looming at you from somewhere near the ceiling - a plus point.). The first night was indifferent owing to the people in the room above indulging in some frantic late-night packing up to midnight ( these guys follow us around, they were in Bologna in June ). No marble here, but the creaky floorboards are not on your side. But the big drawback was the catering - on our first evening we hung about hopefully in the library waiting for bar service & took it in turns with a fellow guest to visit reception occasionally & beg for attention.More muddling through at breakfast ( included in our rate ) : on our first morning no-one cared whether we had been in for breakfast or not, on the second the waitress tried hard to get us to sign an invoice which she said would be applied as a reverse entry on the final account at reception ( why ? ) & on the third there was a perfunctory enquiry as to our room number(s). Naturally we had a good look at the final account & it was the usual consumer-unfriendly morass you find in the UK, peppered with various service charges( the famous " optional " ) & different rates of VAT. The bill for the first night's drinks featured as " Honesty Bar " - oh I SEE ! we were expected to serve ourselves. The accounting function here should take a good long look at itself & think about making sense to the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: walterjg
Reviews.Content: First-class. Great, personal service. No detail too small. Staff made us feel at home immediately. Quiet. Great location - immediately across road from South Kensington underground station. Rt. 14 bus stop right out door (learn to use the bus system!). Access to all London a short ride away. Wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Large, elegant rooms. Stay there. You won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, calm, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pen7376
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convenient location opposite South Kensington tube station. (There was a slight rumble of trains under the building but this was not at all intrusive)There is also a bus stop directly outside and the hotel is very close to the V&A, Science Museum etc Spent one night in the Pelham and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.The staff were friendly, welcoming and efficient. The room was spacious, very comfortable and clean. Room service was good. There are two charming cosy sitting roomsand the breakfast room is bright and pleasant. Continental breakfast was good with a wide selection of fresh fruit, cereals, breads and pastries. We woukd definitely stay in the Pelham again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierbonds
Reviews.Content: We needed to get two rooms, My daughters are considered adults now. The hotel was offering a three nights for two special which made the hotel very affordable in my opinion. The rooms weren't large, but very clean and nice furnishings. The location is literally across the street from the South Kensington Tube station. Very nice after a long day on your feet. The neighborhood has more of a upscale residential feel to it with several restaurants within a walk. The breakfast spread is ample and creative in a handsome space. I did not have any noise issues and our rooms did not have a view.The concierge was very helpful and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms,staff,location and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: justjerry
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in London.For the past 10 years the Pelham has been my home away from home in London.The rooms,even the small ones are great.super comfortable beds,great bathrooms.Staff,especially concierge excellent.Price for London reasonable and location is close to all(across the steret from South Kensington tube,which you can take direct to Heathrow if you travel light as I do).

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toodlepippus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pelham for two nights this weekend having been let down by another hotel. Because we only booked the day before we arrived we probably ended up with one of the least desirable room in terms of location and view (we had room 8 on the first landing which had no view at all, although it was quiet). However, the room itself was prettily furnished and well equipped with mini bar, wardrobe (with good quality hangers and light, which was surprisingly handy) and Penhaligan's toiletries. We were really impressed by the friendly service from all staff we met and loved the continental breakfast which was included in the weekend rate - lots of fresh fruit salads, yoghurts, Danish pastries etc. The location of the hotel was unbeatable, just opposite South Kensington tube on the District, Circle and Piccadilly lines and a block away from the Natural History and V&A Museums. We will definitely be heading back to the Pelham when we are next in London, but will book in advance this time to get a room with a view. We were told that queen doubles are available on the upper floors and that the 4th offers good views and a quiet-ish night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: dankadea
Reviews.Content: the room was beautiful. the location is great. the only problem we had was the noise coming from the air conditioning system (or something like that we assume). and the staff at breakfast was a bit rude.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in the London!!!”
Reviews.Author: NEWLIMERICK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our 3 children. What a fantastic hotel. It is a real find. Well located, friendly staff and a beautifully decorated hotel. Fresh flowers fill the air on entry and the well maintained old world features makes this hotel a pure find. We will definitely return to this hotel. I might add Jamie is a very helpful member of staff. Maeve & Shane.

Reviews.Title: “SO WANTED TO HIDE AWAY LONGER ....”
Reviews.Author: MRSFISH22
Reviews.Content: The Pelham is quite simply wonderful: staff and rooms. Work commitments required an overnight in London to ensure an early start. I arrived tired and grumpy to find a fabulous team of staff used to dealing with every client's mood who within moments of checking in had brightened me up considerably, and I was further uplifted by the quirky stripey pencils found throughout the hotel. "You can have one if you like!" What makes one boutique hotel stand out from another. Surely not a pencil I hear you say but funnily enough, yes a stripey pencil can do that offered in the right way! Further treats followed as I had actually been upgraded [I obviously looked in serious need of TLC]. My room was just perfect, beautiful decor without making me uncomfortable or that I might spoil something if I moved it. Incredibly comfortable bed with seriously delicious bed linen and a fabulous bathroom. Sadly the alarm clock rang way too early and I had to remove myself from the wonderful haven the Pelham provided me with for eleven blissful hours ... you must try and stay there. Feels like home after only one night .....

Reviews.Title: “Not just another corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fairytale2010
Reviews.Content: I come to London quite often for business and I always stay at The Pelham. The staff is extremely friendly and efficient. I love the style of the hotel; it's so pretty and cozy. I feel so relaxed; my favorite spot is the Drawing Room with the honesty bar.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiechickiebabe
Reviews.Content: We love this place, we have stayed here on a few occasions and it is centrally located, great access to South Kensington tube, close to restaurants and shopping. The Pelham is beautifully appointed and the staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a great location”
Reviews.Author: luceykerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely Hotel last week-end , it is just across from the South Kensington tube station . All the staff are were very friendly and helpful . The rooms are nicely decorated and have plenty of natural light in to them , the bathroom is large and bright . There was a good choice for breakfast , we had dinner on the Saturday night , which was great

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: lewsd5544
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay in April - All aspects very good - no fault found.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small hotel, everything perfect except for room temperature”
Reviews.Author: lindacarolina
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel: the location is perfect, right in front of South Kensington tube station, in a lovely area. My room was quite small but absolutely clean and with everything I could think of... except there was no heating! There was only a radiator in the bathroom, which was insufficient to heat up the bedroom. Apart from that, everything was perfect: the staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast is very good and held in a lovely, bright dining room, there are two charming sitting rooms with a fireplace, a laptop is available for guests who need to use the internet. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay, Impeccable Room, Charming Staff, as Good as it Gets”
Reviews.Author: SevilleExpert
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 days at the Pelham and have enjoyed the hotel more than any of my other dozens of stays in London throughout the years. The hotel is inmmaculately well kept, stilish, full-service, professional, charming and immediate and the room had everything that one could ask for in any hotel, no matter how expensive. The breakfast is a delight in their Bistro 15 restaurant, and lunch and dinner provide reliably enjoyable food, very well presented, unpretentious, and harmonious tastes. The location can not be more convenient if you are travelling through Heathrow - just steps off of South Kensington Underground station on the Picaddilly line, no need to change trains. By staying three nights, I was offered a very good deal which I am grateful, and I recommend you call the hotel directly. [--]

Reviews.Title: “STYLISH, FRIENDLY AND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: IKNOWWHATILIKE
Reviews.Content: This elegant Georgian hotel is in a fab location, opposite ken High Street tube station, on good bus routes, has all the popular museums at the top of the road, Harrods and Chelsea on the door step. The decor is a clever mixture of traditional Georgian but with some lovely contemporary touches in the lighting, art work and textiles. Our room was a little cramped but that was because we had a teenager in a 'z' bed however, the three large windows and light touches with the decoration made it feel ok. The bathroom was immaculate and nicely appointed. The hotel has two lounges - one being light and elegant at the front of the hotel with a lovely fire, comfortable sofas, honesty bar (with ice cream in the freezer) , the other has laptop and internet access and being smaller and with darker decor, is cosier. We didn't use the basement restaurant but the menu looked interesting. What also made The Pelham special was Jamie the concierge who was brilliant and made our stay even better with his expert local knowledge and helpful manner. We stayed here over New year and obviously paid New year prices but these were no where near the prices other similar hotels were asking. I would definitely go back and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: clorane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Got a lovely room -- large for London with a superb bathroom at the rear of the hotel. Quiet yet bright. Kiwi at the front desk very helpful and full of info. Breakfast is very good -- fresh and pleasently served. You will not beat the location of this hotel. It is right opposite the Tube entrance and close to alot of the museums. Taxis plentiful. Try the "Fromage shop" opposite for a teatime treat- amazing. Very friendly staff who cannot do enough for you at any time of the day or night. Night Porter brilliant. All in all, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: itrapnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in September with friends and really enjoyed it. The Pelham is a traditional boutique hotel (inside and out). We stayed in a deluxe double, which was a good size at the back of the hotel. The decor was lovely (quite traditional, but not old fashioned), our bathroom was large and very nicely appointed (two sinks, marble floor, shower over the bath etc). All the usual nice hotel things. We loved the honesty bar / lounge - such a great room, filled with interesting antiques - you almost feel like it's your own living room, which I guess is the idea (spent a bit much in there though!!,maybe should have been less honest!). We ate breakfast in the restaurant one day, which was fine (nothing amazing, but nothing to complain about). The staff are friendly and helpful (esp. the kiwi concierge), price good for London, location good (next to South Kensington tube, 15 mins walk from Kings Road, 2 mins walk from Natural History Museum etc). Plenty of restaurants and bars near by - try the Admiral Codrington (pub) and the Enterprise (used to be a pub, now a gorgeous little restaurant). Very good, we'd go back.....

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NowVoyagerQ
Reviews.Content: Our room looked straight out on the dome of the V&A and across wonderfully active S. Kensington Square (this tube stop gets you any and everywhere in London). It seems that French is more the native language in this unpretentious neighborhood because of the Lycee just around the corner. If you want pretentiousness, not to worry, it starts about two blocks down the street on Sloane Street. The front desk of this smallish, nicely appointed hotel is highly professional and is eager to meet every need from the moment you arrive. Fellow guests seem to be regulars or in-the-know (no capri bluejeans and Yankee hat types). Good mix of business professionals. The Pelham's real gem stands at the concierge desk - Jamie - who is a pleasant Kiwi and has the town wired. Last minute reservations at The Ivy, willing to suggest as a matter of practicality the tube (vs. taxi) to certain locations and saved us a small fortune on EuroStar tickets to Paris. If you need yoga whilst visiting, stay away from the LA Fitness down the street and get over to The Life Center in Notting Hill.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional and faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Farenheight
Reviews.Content: My decision to spend two nights at The Pelham over my usual London base was a good one as I found the hotel to be amongst the best accomodation I have experienced in a long time. The location was excellent, just opposite the South Kensington Underground station, although the closure of the Circle/District lines during my stay was a minor inconvenience. I would give a top score to the staff, friendly and helpful, and in particular the restaurant staff who were extremely accommodating with my wife's special dietry requests. The included breakfast was of excellent quality and variety and my evening meal could give any high-end London eatery a run for its money. The ambience of the basement dining room was good - intimate and decorated with unobtrusive modern art. Our room was a good size, amenities were excellent and any concerns I had about it being noisy (there's quite a buzz going on outside, especially at the weekend, with bars and clubs) were unfounded as the double glazing blocked all but the odd inevitable siren. My only complaint was the high cost of wi-fi (£20 for 24 hours), otherwise an experience I intend to repeat as soon as I can. In conclusion, I would recommend The Pelham unconditionally to London visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and very friendly people”
Reviews.Author: theoneiloveorg
Reviews.Content: What I liked were the beautiful rooms with their traditional style and the very friendly people there. It's easy to get to and from the hotel with an underground station (South Kensington), bus and taxi stops next to it. There are also a lot of restaurants and shops in a walking distance. Due to the old windows there's sometimes some noise from the outside, but for me it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bargain, but I loved this place anyway”
Reviews.Author: adventureawaits80
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a great start to our stay here. The room they chose for us had a broken a/c unit. They offered to switch us to a room that sounded like the elevator was traveling directly through it. Someone else on this site gave a more in depth review of that ridiculous room. We stuck with no a/c, but it was a bit hard to sleep. While we were out the next afternoon, they moved all of our stuff to a top floor room with great a/c. The buffet breakfast is lovely and all the rooms are extremely charming. Bathtubs are extremely deep, but I liked that. The hotel is very close to the South Kensington Tube stop. Give yourself a minute or two to get oriented. There is a lot of construction going on in that intersection.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property with amazing staff... but not for the light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: agsinspace
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely boutique hotel. The staff were friendly and the rooms truly gorgeous and spacious, especially for London. I stayed in three different rooms during my stay... two of which were grand and beautiful and one which was just nice... all in my quest to find a quiet room. This is the downfall of the Pelham. While it is very conveniently located in South Kensington right next to the tube station exit, it is located in South Kensington next to the tube station. The tube runs for 18 hours a day and each time it does, you hear... or feel... the rumble, depending on where in the hotel you're located. While my partner was not at all bothered by this as he is more used to city noise, for me, a very light sleeper, I found it quite distracting. This is, however, the only negative I could say about the Pelham.. .for me, it was a big one, but honestly, I wish it wasn't because I loved this place. The staff were fantastically friendly and helpful, the hotel itself was very well appointed and very conveniently located. If you do not mind some street noise and a rumbling metro, I would definitely recommend it as a top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but dont stay in room 401!”
Reviews.Author: GBland
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel and the service good. Great location with the Natural History Museum and the Science Museum a 5 min walk away. Lots of restaurants and cafe's around the area too. Only one fault and that was the room we were in that we had to be moved from on the second night. Room 401 was right next to the lift shaft and we heard loud rumbling every time it was used. As the hotel was full on the first night this happened a lot and late into the night! I would imagine that any room on the other floors ending in '01 would have had the same problem. Apart from this the hotel was very pleasant, and met our expectations. We got a 2 for 1 deal and paid £180+VAT for the 2 nights which was reasonable. I think though if I had paid £180 for both nights I would have been angry with the first night being pretty much sleepless with the noise.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel; excellent service; one of the best”
Reviews.Author: zsuzu
Reviews.Content: In summary: I’d rank this hotel ‘off the scale’ and at '5 plus'. The service was wonderful, the décor in the hotel and the room were lovely – stylish, comfortable and fitting for the place – and the hotel and room were very clean and well maintained, the bed was great, and the continental breakfast was excellent. This hotel is up there as one of the top 3 hotels I have ever stayed at considering service, décor, comfort and the overall ‘experience’. I plan to stay again on any return trip to London. I had a ‘deluxe’ – which is a basic room in this hotel. My room was on the top floor (#402). The room was very well decorated (pinstriped fabric walls, a great mix of furniture) and was a great size for one but would have been perfectly fine for a couple. The bed (and bedding) was excellent – I have a bad back and it’s rare for me to really enjoy a bed in a hotel. Part of our response to rooms and hotels as travelers is always whether they click for us and I have to say I loved my room and the hotel. I can’t say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff were – a very high quality experience. Despite being booked in the cheap seats – so to speak – I received top level service that clearly doesn’t distinguish between guests. As a small hotel with excellent service staff were very quick to learn what I needed and enjoyed and, as some other reviews of this hotel have noted, start to anticipate my wishes. Genuinely excellent service. The location is good – a pleasant and safe neighbourhood – very close to the V&A and the Natural History Museum. It’s located right across the road from the South Kensington tube station which has three lines running through – this makes it very easy to get around London from the hotel. Based on rates for other London hotels, the rate I had and the quality of my stay I believe the hotel represents excellent value for money within the boutique hotel London market. Two warnings. First, although I found the room very quiet – despite some temporary near by road construction – I had one staff person ask me if I could hear the trains – apparently some top floor guests can. If this would bother you, you should ask about room location and noise when booking. Second, these are converted old townhouses. In my room (and some others) the bathroom drains run slowly – not a question of maintenance but one of age and the vagaries of older buildings – this didn’t bother me or cause any problems. I know this type of thing bothers some people – be aware if you are one of these folks and ask about this when booking your room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Franners
Reviews.Content: They made a nice fuss of our honeymoon stopover. Lovely rooms, well soundproofed from the road noise. Lots to do close by. Excellent overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, welcoming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: FatherBryan
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Pelham and 'found' it through a 2 nights for the price of 1 offer at boutique hotels in a national newspaper, so this was great value for us! We were made to feel very welcome by the friendly staff, but did not feel smothered. We had a Superior Double, as the helpful receptionist told me on the phone, when I called to ask about rooms, that the Queen Doubles were a bit on the small side. Our room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and well appointed. We looked out on to a nearby building but we do not expect views in locations like this. The hotel is so convenient, right opposite the entrance to South Kensington underground station, 15 easy minutes walk to Harrods, close to the main museums. We used room service 3 times, including breakfast as we did not want any of the various breakfasts offered in the dining room, and we were very satisfied with service; an omission on one occasion was quickly rectified. I would not hesitate to pay a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff = great stay”
Reviews.Author: buffgray
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room # 2 on the ground level on the front of the hotel. A bus stop is outside the windows of room #2. Room is done in pink and green. Water pressure in bathroom was strong. Heated towel rack in bathroom was a nice touch. Four sets of towels provided twice daily. Combination bathtub/shower is done in granite and large Curtains worked well for blacking out the windows. Safe in bureau is easy to program and large enough to hold two shoe boxes. Refrigerator and snack bar is in bureau. Prices are more than twice the prices across the street at convenience stores. Television offers 16 channels Housekeeping services rooms twice a day Room service is available 24 hours a day Complimentary umbrella and slippers provided Complimentary box of chocolates were left during the first night turndown service Honor bar is in the sitting room The staff is great. The front desk and concierge were always cheery and helpful. The concierge has great suggestions for restaurants. Restaurants recommended include Admiral Codringtons (English Pub), Daphne’s (Italian), Papillion (French) all within walking distance. Staff at Daphne’s seemed to give us preferential treatment once told we were from the Pelham Hotel. Bistro 15 (basement level) is a small restaurant. The food was good, but nothing special. The continental breakfast selection includes sliced fruits, cereals, pastries, and parfaits. The dinner service was average. There were some slow nights during the week that made it easy to get a table for a quick bite.. Prices at the bar are much higher than the Pub (Hoop and Toy) across the street. Nearby: Cave la Fromage, a cheese store is across the street. Cheese and wine tasting occur frequently. Decent prices Smile Café is across the street. Nice place to pickup a quick snack heading to/from the South Kensington tube stop South Kensington tube stop of the Underground is across the street. It is very easy to get to. There is a taxi queue right around the corner from the Pelham Hotel Recommendations: Take the Express train from Heathrow to Paddington Station. It is worth the extra money (33 pounds total) to avoid the frequent stops on the regular train. Buy an Oyster card for the Tube. It makes taking the Tube easier and faster. If you are planning on taking a few walking tours, ask about a discount card (2 pounds per person) from the walking tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Addlington
Reviews.Content: We found out about the Pelham through friends, and it is also one of the hotels mentioned by Rick Steves in his London 2009 guidebook. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and overall it was a great hotel. It's a charming block of townhouses in central London that feels more like a home than a cookie cutter, corporate hotel. The room we stayed in was very large, especially by London standards, and extremely clean with a fantastic cleaning staff with good timing. The room had all of the upscale amenities expected such as a flatscreen tv, wireless hi-speed internet access (this was a bit pricey at 20 GBP/day, so we only used this ), large bathroom, mini-bar, bathrobes, etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful; they were there when we needed them, but otherwise greatly respected our privacy. A few things we noted. The bathroom, which is a recently renovated marble/granite, had a great shower and Aveda products. However, the layout of the bathroom made it almost impossible to get out of the tub/shower easily. The tub/shower did not have a curtain or a door, instead there was a glass pane that blocked half of the tub. The other half of the tub where you could get out was blocked by the toilet. If you're handicapped in any way, or afraid of slipping in the tub/shower, then this most likely won't work for you. It's a minor inconvenience, that I think only affects a few rooms. The location of the hotel is great, across the street from the South Kensington Underground stop. The stop is fantastic for the Piccadilly, Circle, and District lines which can take you straight to Piccadilly Circus, Oxford Circus, Westminster Abbey, Tower of London, etc. The surrounding neighborhood is very busy, and there is a lot of construction going on on the streets surrounding the hotel, so a room away from the street (which ours luckily was) will really help cut the traffic noise. While the neighborhood is perfectly safe, we weren't too keen on the traffic or congestion surrounding the hotel. Within the hotel, there was very little noise from the hallway, and virtually no noise from the other rooms. I felt our room was a cozy place away from all of the chaos of the surrounding neighborhood. The Pelham is a bit pricey, but we found a great online deal so definitely search the travel sites for a reservation before going straight to the hotel's website to make a reservation. It may be more money than other London hotels, but you'll be guaranteed a classy hotel close to a highly convenient tube stop, and a clean, cozy, quiet upscale room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely !”
Reviews.Author: lin23
Reviews.Content: Just opposite the South Ken. tube station, or few minutes walk from the V&A museum the Pelham has a wonderful location. The design of the rooms is amazing, and the bath room is relatively big (with Aveda products). The drawing room with fire place is cozy and inviting, the breakfast is nice (you can get a freshly cooked english one as well). The stuff was ready to help and smiling, whatever we needed. The Pelham is a really nice hotel, with quality service. But : the rooms can get hot (even on 1st of March, with no heating on - it wasn't quite clear to us, how it comes), and unfortunately the windows can't keep off the traffic noise from the busy junction in the front of the hotel (we had a room on the 4th floor and still it was too loud to sleep quietly). I guess you wouldn’t have this problem though, when having a room away of the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paris28
Reviews.Content: We Loved the Pelham Hotel with it's cozy welcoming style. My husband and I were there for three nights in December. Modern boutique hotel in a great location near V and A museum and across the street from the South Kensington Tube. Our room was larger than normal for London with a beautiful marble bathroom, very nice linens and thick towels. The staff was very friendly - big part on why this was such a special place. Sweet welcome gift (lavender sachet) and water at turndown. We had continental breakfast at the Bistro every morning (it was included in the price of our room). Nice selection of food – we loved the fruit and yogurt parfait. I also ate lunch in the Bistro while my husband was at work. Good food and they made me feel very comfortable eating alone. Really enjoyed both of the cozy common rooms – one with a fireplace and the other free use of a computer with internet access. A special place in London. We’ll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Boutique!”
Reviews.Author: bostonkatie
Reviews.Content: We looooooooved the Pelham! I stayed with my sister in mom in a luxury double for three nights, and the space was just right even with the extra foldaway bed - not usually the case in London. We had a great view and lots of sunlight, but the light-blocking shades helped us sleep in on our first morning in town. Even though the hotel is located at a busy intersection, we didn't hear a thing because of the double windows.
